p: To quantify the Se of qPCR, the infection process was subdivided into three phases: (i) the preclinical phase, the period in days from challenge to the onset of clinical signs; (ii) the clinical phase, the period from the onset of clinical signs (which was defined as the appearance of one or more vesicles on the feet, mouth, tongue, or nose) to the rupture of the first vesicles; and (iii) the early-recovery phase, which was the period from the rupture of vesicles to the end of monitoring (at âˆ¼7 or 8 dpc).
